skill.name: clean-code
skill.description: Applies principles from Robert C. Martin's 'Clean Code'. Use this skill when writing, reviewing, or refactoring code to ensure high quality, readability, and maintainability. Covers naming, functions, comments, error handling, and class design.
skill.summary: Clean Code guidance for naming, functions, comments, and design.
skill.author: sickn33

security_audit.summary: Static findings pointed to command execution, cryptography, and reconnaissance, but the file contains only documentation text. The only URL is a source attribution link, not a network action. No security risks were confirmed.

low_findings.title: False positive: external command execution
low_findings.description: No command execution exists; the lines are prose and inline examples. Confidence: 0.2. Confidence reasoning: Only backticked identifiers and text appear.

low_findings.title: False positive: weak cryptography
low_findings.description: No cryptographic algorithms are used; these lines are descriptive text. Confidence: 0.15. Confidence reasoning: No crypto APIs or hashes appear.

low_findings.title: False positive: system reconnaissance
low_findings.description: The cited lines describe naming and design guidance, not system inspection. Confidence: 0.2. Confidence reasoning: No commands or environment reads are present.

low_findings.title: Informational: external URL reference
low_findings.description: The URL is a source attribution link in metadata, not a runtime network request. Confidence: 0.35. Confidence reasoning: It appears only in the front matter.

content.user_title: Improve code clarity with Clean Code checks
content.value_statement: Teams struggle with inconsistent style and unclear intent in code. This skill applies Clean Code principles to guide clearer naming, structure, and reviews.
actual_capabilities: Review code text against Clean Code naming and function rules
Provide checklists for refactoring and code review sessions
Summarize common code smells and heuristics to watch
Suggest comment and formatting improvements based on guidelines
Advise on error handling and unit test principles
limitations: Does not execute or analyze real repositories or files
Cannot verify runtime behavior or performance
Advice is generic and may conflict with team style guides
No automatic code transformations or patches

use_cases.title: Pull request review notes
use_cases.description: Generate concise review guidance based on Clean Code principles for a submitted change.

use_cases.title: Refactor planning checklist
use_cases.description: Create a step list to simplify functions and remove code smells in a legacy module.

use_cases.title: Team standards workshop
use_cases.description: Outline shared naming, function, and comment rules for a team style session.

prompt_templates.title: Quick naming review
prompt_templates.prompt: Review these identifiers and suggest clearer names: [paste names].

prompt_templates.title: Function focus check
prompt_templates.prompt: Assess this function for size, single responsibility, and arguments: [paste function].

prompt_templates.title: Refactor plan
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a refactor plan for this file using Clean Code steps: [describe file].

prompt_templates.title: Heuristic audit
prompt_templates.prompt: Audit this module for code smells and prioritize fixes with rationale: [describe module].

output_examples.input: Review a function for Clean Code issues.
output_examples.output: Findings: name is vague, function mixes validation and persistence, suggest split and rename.

output_examples.input: Create a refactor checklist for a legacy module.
output: Extract clear names for domain concepts

best_practices: Ask for intent and outcomes before proposing renames
Prefer small functions with one level of abstraction
Use concrete, searchable names over abbreviations
anti_patterns: Suggesting refactors without understanding team constraints
Enforcing rules that conflict with established style guides
Prioritizing formatting over clarity and behavior

faq.question: What inputs work best for this skill?
faq.answer: Short code excerpts or concise descriptions of modules and their intent.

faq.question: Does this skill modify my code automatically?
faq.answer: No, it provides guidance and checklists only.

faq.question: Can it replace a human code review?
faq.answer: No, it supports reviewers but does not validate behavior or tests.

faq.question: How does it handle existing team standards?
faq.answer: Use it as a reference and adapt suggestions to your team rules.

faq.question: Is it suitable for any programming language?
faq.answer: Yes, the guidance is language agnostic and focuses on design and clarity.

faq.question: What is the main benefit?
faq.answer: It improves readability and maintainability through consistent Clean Code practices.
